Are the three that are live, few builders are around and hence the lack of payloads

author: pk910
content: I've added them to dora too, so blocks are marked as mev blocks

author: butta
content: Thanks. We are working on the visibility of the updated queue time of individual validators as well as network wide queue time. We have several pectra changes in the pipeline, but they were not deployed on hoodi yet. This includes updated APR calculations, overall accounting, queue times and consolidation information on the validator and slot view

author: parithosh
content: <@144468805697929216> do you think we can get some attestation packing efficiency data from vouch running on hoodi? i.e, we want to see how clients are performing in comparison to each other for a given slot

author: jgm
content:
We don't have anything like that available now, we moved away from scoring blocks manually when the `consensus_value` information was added into blocks v3.  I could attempt to resurrect some of that code, although it may take a bit of time as it isn't electra-compatible and the changes to attestations in electra would require a rewrite of our duplicate detection codebase.

Let me see what I can come up with.

author: parithosh
content:
Thank you for trying!
ah damn, we might have to then rely on other analysis methods for now - cc <@586161934425128960>

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: Assuming BN scores blocks correctly the comparision should work.

author: jgm
content:
I've thrown together something that requests proposals from each beacon node at the beginning of each slot, and grabs the attestation data from them.  This doesn't do analysis, but does gather the data so that it can be analysed later.  Is this any use?

Sample data attached.

author: jgm
content: (And if you would rather run it yourself I can give you the source code.)

author: parithosh
content: Depends on what <@777935002263617576> <@586161934425128960> and other cl teams are looking for üòÑ

author: nflaig
content: honestly I thought using the consensus reward of the block would be a good metric to look at

author: serenita_io
content:
This is the raw CL block value data for epochs 2,248-2,748 . Might save someone some CPU time, those API requests took quite long.

Will post a gist with more numbers in <#1355135232399114240> later today, need about one more hour to finish processing.

author: jgm
content: I'm not sure that consensus value will give that much detail, given it's an aggregate value and the biggest concern that I can see is that we are failing to include a lot of attestations in the subsequent slot.  I think the primary question that we need to answer for any given proposal is "what is the number of validator indices included with distance 1, as a % of all possible indices?"

author: samcm
content: I started building a notebook with this analysis (and more) before/after the fork, grouped per entity. Will tidy it up and post my findings today üôè

author: jgm
content:
Hmm... am I misunderstanding `committee_bits` in the `Attestation` object in Electra?  For example:

```
curl -s http://localhost:5052/eth/v2/beacon/blocks/103585 | jq -r .data.message.body.attestations[].committee_bits
0xffffffffffffffff
0xffffffffffffffff
0xffffffffffffffff
0x0000000010000000
0x0000000008000000
0x0008000000000000
0x2000000000000000
0x0000004000000000
```

Those first three responses seem odd to me, we don't have that number of committees so why are the bits set?

author: terencechain
content: this is from perspective of prysm proposer that pack attestations every slot in hoodi testnet: https://hackmd.io/@ttsao/attestation-packing-pectra

author: jgm
content: So we do have that number of committees on hoodi then?  In that case, fair enough.

author: jgm
content:
A quick scan of data suggests that nimbus is packing out-of-date attestations sometimes.  For example, for slot 103678 the proposal included the attached attestations.  Other times it sends us timely attestations.

```
Nimbus beacon node v25.3.1-c00f35-stateofus
```

author: serenita_io
content:
> "what is the number of validator indices included with distance 1, as a % of all possible indices?"

I have "Number of unique attesters voting for the previous slot whose attestation was included" in my gist, sounds almost the same? ( See https://ptb.discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1355135232399114240/1356385841416765451 )

author: jgm
content: Could well be, and it seems to show the same thing that I just mentioned for nimbus, in that their mean is significantly down on the other nodes, and that there are a significant percentage of blocks not including anything for the previous slot.

author: samcm
content: Some of my initial findings yesterday pointed the same way with Nimbus üôÇ

author: jgm
content:
Okay sounds like this is something worth investigating.  <@&595681804422479873> anyone around who can pick up on this and find out what is going wrong?

If we ignore the nimbus entries, I think that we are a little north of 90% inclusion at distance 1, although tht's still a fair few missing attestations.  Do we have that many validators offline for hoodi, or is something else going on?

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content: Participation in Hoodi seems to be fluctuating around 90%

author: samcm
content: There is roughly 72k of the _known_ validators offline according to Dora, which is ~7% right there
